can you write first hymn of rigveda

The first hymn of Rigveda is dedicated to Lord Agni (the god of fire). It is known as the "Agni Sukta" and was composed by Rishi Madhucchandas. Here is the hymn in English transliteration:

1. Agnim īḷe purōhitam̐
Yajñasya devam ŗtvijam
Hōtāram̐ ratnad hātamam

2. Agniḥ pūrvebhir rṣibhir
Īḍyō nūtanair uta
Sa devān eha vakṣati

3. Agna nāya supathā rāye
Asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān
Yuyodhy asmaj juhurān̐am eno
Bhūyiṣṭhāṁ te nama uktim vidhema

Translation:

1. I worship Agni, the high priest of the sacrifice,
The divine, the invoker, the best bestower of treasures.

2. Agni has been praised by the ancient Rishis,
As well as the recent ones; he leads the gods here (to the ceremony).

3. O Agni, through the good path, lead us to riches,
Knowing all the divine powers, remove the obstacles.
To you who are mighty, we offer our salutations and praises.
